page.title: 05GOVILLEY FARM - TREGONY
page.content: THIS FARM IS TYPICAL OF THE ROSELAND PENINSULAR OF CORNWALL. IT OCCUPIES 163 ACRES OF WHICH 31 WERE ACQUIRED IN 1937. 20 YEARS AGO THERE WERE FOUR FARMWORKERS:IT IS NOW REDUCED TO THREE. NO LAND HAS BEEN LOST TO BUILDING DEVE- LOPMENT AND NONE RECLAIMED FROM MARSH OR WOODLAND. THE FARM ECONOMY IS BASED ON DAIRYING WITH ARABLE PLAYING A STRONG SUPPORTING ROLE WITH FODDER NEEDS. 9 AREAS ARE SOWN WITH WINTER BARLEY AND 21 WITH SPRING BARLEY, WHICH IS USED FOR FODDER. THE FARM PRODUCES ITS OWN HAY (NO SILAGE) WITH HEAVY USE OF NITRATE FERTILIZERS TO MAXIMISE YEILD, AND IN SOME YEARS A SURPLUS IS SOLD TO LOCAL FARMERS.LIVESTOCK INCLUDES 50 EWES AND MILKING FRESIANS, THE HANDLING OF WHICH IS NOW EASED BY A NEW MILKING PARLOUR. THEY BREED THEIR OWN CALVES, RESERVING THE BEST FOR THEIR OWN HERD AND SELLING THE SURPLUS
